column4: how do i resolve my eth0 error: "The interface does not exist"
sudo ifconfig eth0 up
I'm using eth0 now to talk. But system says it doesn't exits. (Go figure)
it's probably eth1 then
So yeah it's up.
no. I only have one wired net connection.
I want to config eth0, But systems says it doesn't exist when I try to config.
pastebin the output of these commands:    "sudo ifconfig -a"  "cat /etc/network/interfaces"
http://paste.ubuntu.com/9196/
ok what about /etc/network/interfaces please
and whatever command gives you the error
http://paste.ubuntu.com/9197/
Any ideas?
should it be dhcp or what
add to your /etc/network/interfaces file two lines    "auto eth0"    "iface eth0 inet dhcp"   that will load up the interface automatically on boot
well, I'll be buggered if I know how it got 10.1.144.10 (My dhcp server is set to allocate 10.1.144.100+) [it was manualy set to 10.1.144.10 under fedora before i installed ubuntu
did you pick to import the user preferences during the install?
HOLD on....... I know why it's 10.1.144.10. (Static assignment by mac address). so yeah it's dhcp and ip assignment is  working correctly.
but I still can't config it on the ubuntu box. It does come up automaticaly on boot though.
No, I just erased the fedora partition. no importing - but thats not relevent. (because it's static assigned via mac address as I just mentioned)
add to your /etc/network/interfaces file two lines    "auto eth0"    "iface eth0 inet dhcp"   that will load up the interface automatically on boot
it already works automaticaly on boot.
I just can't config the stupid thing.
